content.title: Scheme for Pension Benefits to the Journalists/Photojournalists
content.department: Department of Information and Cultural Affairs
content.beneficiary: Accredited Journalists/Photojournalists aged 60 years and above
content.details: 'Scheme for Pension Benefits to the Journalists/photojournalists' was launched by the Department of Information and Cultural Affairs, Government of Tripura. The objective is to provide financial assistance in the form of a Pension to accredited Journalists/ Photojournalists aged 60 years and above. The application should be submitted to the Director of Information and Cultural Affairs Department, Government of Tripura.
eligibility: The applicant should be 18 years or older.
The applicant retired from the job as an accredited journalist/photojournalist in Tripura.
The applicant should have done 10 years of service in Tripura.
The applicant should not have received a pension from other sources, except under the Employees Provident Fund (EPF).
The beneficiary should be 60 years or older to receive the pension.
content.application_process: Offline. The interested applicant should take print of the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents. The applicant submits the duly filled and signed application form with the documents to the Director of Information and Cultural Affairs Department, Government of Tripura.
documents_required: Press Accreditation Card (Issued by the Information and Cultural Affairs Department (ICA) Tripura)
Admit card (School Final Examination or Madhyamik Examination or Higher Secondary Examination or Equivalent Public Examination)
Original Affidavit (Sworn before a Notary Public, stating the date of birth of the applicant)

faqs.question: What is the age requirement for journalists/photojournalists to be eligible for pension benefits?
faqs.answer: Journalists/photojournalists must be at least 60 years old to be eligible for pension benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum work experience required for journalists/photojournalists under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants must have a minimum of 10 years of work experience in Tripura as journalists/photojournalists.

faqs.question: Can retired journalists/photojournalists from outside Tripura apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Only journalists/photojournalists with 10 years of work experience in Tripura are eligible for pension benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any exceptions to the minimum work experience requirement for journalists/photojournalists?
faqs.answer: No exceptions are made to the minimum work experience requirement for journalists/photojournalists under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any financial assistance provided other than the monthly pension under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The benefit provided under the scheme is a monthly pension of ₹10,000.

faqs.question: Can journalists/photojournalists who have received pensions from other sources apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Journalists/photojournalists who have received pensions from other sources except under the Employees Provident Fund (EPF) are not eligible for benefits under this scheme.

faqs.question: Are there any specific guidelines regarding the submission of the birth certificate?
faqs.answer: The birth certificate must be submitted as per specified guidelines to ensure accuracy and validity.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline for submitting applications under the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no specific deadline mentioned for submitting applications under the scheme.

faqs.question: What happens after the applicant submits the application?
faqs.answer: Upon receipt of the application, the concerned authority will make necessary entries in the application receipt register. Additionally, a unique identification number will be assigned to the applicant for future reference and as acknowledgement for the receipt of the application.

faqs.question: Where should the duly filled and signed application form be submitted?
faqs.answer: The applicant must submit the completed application form along with the required documents to the Director of Information and Cultural Affairs Department, Government of Tripura.

faqs.question: Can I track the status of my application online using the unique identification number?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately, online tracking facilities may not be available. However, you can inquire about the status of your application by contacting the relevant authorities.

faqs.question: How long does it typically take for the authorities to assign a unique identification number after I submit my application?
faqs.answer: The unique identification number is usually assigned immediately upon submission of the application.

faqs.question: Is there a specific format for attaching the mandatory documents, such as self-attestation or notarization?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is required to self-attest all the mandatory documents before attaching them to the application form.
